Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "dev mode, mixin in sfc is merged before vue-router plugin install" (#6609) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
2.4.3

### Reproduction link
[https://github.com/Astray-git/vue-router-mixin-issue](https://github.com/Astray-git/vue-router-mixin-issue)

### Steps to reproduce
run project with `npm run dev` open console, navigate to /foo/bar.
refresh page see logs in console.

put a breakpoint in vue.esm.js's [`mergeOptions` function](https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/ef432c6e86d34d891034fd7668a85793be4a2607/dist/vue.esm.js#L1375). you can see vue merges the mixin before `Vue.use(vueRouter)` 

build with `npm run build` start the page with http-server, try same above, it works as expected.

### What is expected?
`beforeRouteEnter` from mixin get called after refresh

console:
```
mixin beforeRouteEnter
component beforeRouteEnter
mixin created
component created
component beforeRouteEnter next
mixin beforeRouteEnter next
```

### What is actually happening?
only `created` in mixin is called
console:
```
component beforeRouteEnter
mixin created
component created
component beforeRouteEnter next
```

---
vue-router version 2.7.0

in dev mode, router mixins are merged before vue-router strategies get isntalled.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened pull request "feat(v-model): warn for undefined binding values (#5932)" (#6734) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
Warn when the v-model binding value is undefined so users are aware that the binding may not be
reactive.

Fixes #5932

<!--
Please make sure to read the Pull Request Guidelines:
https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request-guidelines
-->

<!-- PULL REQUEST TEMPLATE -->
<!-- (Update "[ ]" to "[x]" to check a box) -->

**What kind of change does this PR introduce?** (check at least one)

- [ ] Bugfix
- [x] Feature
- [ ] Code style update
- [ ] Refactor
- [ ] Build-related changes
- [ ] Other, please describe:

**Does this PR introduce a breaking change?** (check one)

- [ ] Yes
- [x] No

If yes, please describe the impact and migration path for existing applications:

**The PR fulfills these requirements:**

- [x] It's submitted to the `dev` branch for v2.x (or to a previous version branch), _not_ the `master` branch
- [x] When resolving a specific issue, it's referenced in the PR's title (e.g. `fix #xxx[,#xxx]`, where "xxx" is the issue number)
- [x] All tests are passing: https://github.com/vuejs/vue/blob/dev/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#development-setup
- [x] New/updated tests are included

If adding a **new feature**, the PR's description includes:
- [x] A convincing reason for adding this feature (to avoid wasting your time, it's best to open a suggestion issue first and wait for approval before working on it)

**Other information:**

I'm not sure if checking if the value is undefined is the right thing to do. I was hoping to do some kind of `hasOwnProperty`-like check to see if the key in the object exists, but I couldn't figure out how to do that. If that's what makes more sense a pointer in the right direction would be awesome.

Thanks.

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed pull request "Update translation. Remove incorrect using of the term "pure function"" (#965) at vuejs/vuex
Events.RelatedBody: The term "pure function" ("чистые функции" in russian) used incorrectly in the translation. A mutation can not be a pure function, because it changes the state of the passed argument. This term should be translated as "просто функции" or "функции" ("just function" in english).
